alert.note: Alert for Gordon; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 9:44AM EDT until September 06 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Georgia, including the following counties, Chattooga, Floyd, Gordon and Walker. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rome, Summerville, Trion, Lyerly, Menlo, James H. Floyd State Park, Tidings, Berryton, Holland, Armuchee, Chattoogaville, Subligna, Coosa, Cloudland, Everett Springs and Lake Marvin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
